page.title: 13THREE GENERATIONS I
page.content: Mr. Strong was born near Southampton in l9l2. His parents moved to Woolley near Bath when he was one. His father kept a public house, mother didn't work, and he had one sister. He started at Swainswick School, his only School, when he was 5 and had to walk there. There were six classes all in one building. There were l5 children in his class and 3 women teachers in the School. They had to bring their own lunches, which for most people was bread and cheese, there were no school dinners. There was no playground and they had to play in the road. He never went into Bath but his mother went to shop there and had to walk. They had to make their own enter _ tainment like boxing, dancing in a barn and tug of war. Mr. Strong worked on a farm and his wife looked after the family.
